roleset.name: move in a circle or spiral, quickly

example.name: whirl-v: straight intransitive
example.text: They whirled and saw him, standing there dim in the slatted light from the boarded freight wall.

example.name: whirl-v: particle as axis
example.text: He whirled around, suddenly hot all over, finding the man who had been standing before him a few moments back, nailing him to thespot on which he now stood, open-mouthed.

example.name: whirl-v: not an axis
example.text: A tune began [*]to whirl inside his head .

roleset.note: WHIRL-V NOTES: Frames file for 'whirl' based on sentences in brown. Verbnet entries 9.6, 51.3.1 (from whirl.01-v predicate notes)

roleset.name: natural disaster: tornado (usually fire)

example.name: firewhirl-n: arg1, ADJ (because of our tagging conventions for relative clauses)
example.text: Another extreme example of a fire tornado from other than a vegetation fire is the 1923 Great Kant? earthquake in Japan which ignited a large city-sized firestorm and produced a gigantic firewhirl that killed 38,000 in fifteen minutes in the Hifukusho-Atoregion of Tokyo.
example.arg: that killed 38,000 in fifteen minutes in the Hifukusho-Atoregion of Tokyo.

roleset.note: WHIRL-N NOTES: Added by Julia in a Natural Disaster roleset endeavor. Comparison to tornado, twister. (from whirl.01-n)
The "VSP" function tags on 'death/injury toll' and 'damages/cost' correspond to the RED cause relation.
